title: Trump 'not ready' for China trade deal, dismisses recession fears
text: U.S. President Donald Trump and top White House officials dismissed concerns that economic growth may be faltering, saying on Sunday they saw little risk of recession despite a volatile week on global bond markets, and insisting their trade war with China was doing no damage to the United States.

title: Fear needs to get more extreme for stocks to bottom, BofA's Stephen Suttmeier says
text: BofA-Merrill Lynch's Stephen Suttmeier highlights two charts that suggest the S&P 500 won't break out of its slump for weeks.

title: White House advisor Kudlow on economic concerns: 'I don't see a recession at all'
text: Kudlow pointed to strong retail sales and low unemployment as signs that the U.S. economy remained strong.

title: White House says 'no recession in sight' despite market turmoil
text: White House officials pushed back on Sunday against concerns that economic growth may be faltering, saying they saw little risk of recession despite a volatile week on global bond markets, and insisting their trade war with China was doing no damage to the United States.

title: This Fed event could be the market's make or break moment this week
text: Bianco Research's James Bianco suggests Wall Street is desperately looking for a sign that a 50 basis point cut is coming next month.

title: Asia stocks gain as China rates tweak lifts investor mood
text: Asian stocks tracked the Wall Street rally on Monday and found an extra tailwind from a move by China's central bank to change the way a key interest rate benchmark is set, seen by analysts as reducing borrowing costs for companies.

title: The US economy is fine, but watch out for gathering trade storms
text: The German trade surplus is stifling the economic growth in the rest of Europe, Michael Ivanovitch writes.

title: Oil rises after Saudi oilfield attack, but recession worries cap gains
text: Crude oil prices rose on Monday following a weekend attack on a Saudi oil facility by Yemeni separatists, although price gains were capped by an unusually downbeat OPEC report that stoked concerns about demand growth.

title: Asia stocks rise as stimulus, policy hopes calm nervous investors
text: Asian stocks rose on Monday as hopes of more stimulus from central banks around the world and steps being taken by major economies such as Germany and China soothed investors' fears of a sharp global economic slump.

title: Trump says he doesn't want to do business with Huawei due to national security concerns
text: “I don’t want to do business at all because it is a national security threat,” Trump told reporters.

title: The VIX Projects the S&P Going Bearish
text: The VIX suggests the S&P 500 will be 5% lower in a month. If that's so, prepare for a full on bear market.

title: White House trade advisor Navarro: 'Technically we did not have a yield curve inversion'
text: The yield on the 10-year Treasury note fell below the 2-year rate Wednesday, which typically taken as a sign a recession is on the horizon.

title: U.S. whiskey exporters struggle after year of EU tariffs
text: When Europe's tariffs on U.S. whiskey hit in June 2018, craft distillery Mountain Laurel Spirits LLC lost 10% of its sales overnight as its European distributor simply stopped buying its award-winning Dad's Hat Pennsylvania Rye Whiskey.

title: G.E. Is Accused of Major Fraud, and Stocks Take a Beating
text: Plus, WeWork takes steps to go public, and investigations into the Jeffrey Epstein case continue.

title: U.S.-China Trade War: It's Time For A Change In Strategy
text: A legalistic approach that works in the U.S. would be ineffective in China.
